children.text:
In Fortran:

program main

integer :: N, num
integer(8) :: x
integer(8), allocatable :: sweet(:)

read*, N, x

allocate( sweet(N) ) do i =1,N
   read*, sweet(i)
end do

call sort(sweet) ! sorts in ascending order. num =0 

do while ( num < N ) if ( x < sweet( num+1 ) ) exit 
   x =x - sweet(num+1)
   num = num+1 
end do 

! Now check the condition:

if ( (num ==N) .and. (x>0) ) then 
   num = num-1 
end if 

print*, num

deallocate(sweet)
end program

In Fortran:

program main

integer :: N, num
integer(8) :: x
integer(8), allocatable :: sweet(:)

read*, N, x

allocate( sweet(N) )

do i =1,N
   read*, sweet(i)
end do

call sort(sweet) ! sorts in ascending order.

num =0 

do while ( num < N )
   if ( x < sweet( num+1 ) ) exit 
   x =x - sweet(num+1)
   num = num+1 
end do 

! Now check the condition:

if ( (num ==N) .and. (x>0) ) then 
   num = num-1 
end if 

print*, num

deallocate(sweet)
end program
